fullText: Tyne Daly brings her formidable presence to the role of Maria Callas in Terrence McNally's 'Master Class,' but the production feels more like a solid B+ effort than the A+ triumph it could be.
dtliExcerpt: Tyne Daly brings her formidable presence to the role of Maria Callas in Terrence McNally's 'Master Class,' but the production feels more like a solid B+ effort than the A+ triumph it could be.
bwwExcerpt: Daly achieves a decent approximation of Callas' look thanks to spot-on makeup and a wig. But while she's a terrific actress, her basic earthiness is at odds with the role of the refined woman nicknamed 'La Divina.' Daly nails the catty asides about Callas' peers and can switch from imperious to coyly flirtatious in the blink of an eye. But there are also times when you wonder if Callas is coaching aspiring opera singers or a softball team. And when she drops the soprano's signature 'eh' at the end of sentences, Daly's lands in the Atlantic somewhere between Italy and Canada.
showScoreExcerpt: Tyne Daly brings her formidable presence to the role of Maria Callas in Terrence McNally's 'Master Class,' but the production feels more like a solid B+ effort than the A+ triumph it could be.
